summary: This is a discovery request letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter requests extensive discovery and Brady material related to Maxwell's criminal case, including information about victims, witnesses, the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein, and various investigations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is a discovery request on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced as the central figure in the underlying abuse allegations. The letter requests documents related to his 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement and communications with his attorneys.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the discovery request letter on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Mentioned as being investigated by the FBI for obstruction of justice. The defense requests the complete FBI case file on this investigation.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Listed among the 'Attorneys' representing victims in the case. The defense requests communications between these attorneys and prosecutors.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Listed among the 'Attorneys' representing victims in the case.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Listed among the 'Attorneys' representing victims in the case.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in connection with Epstein's alleged sex trafficking scheme. The defense requests materials concerning their interactions and the investigation into both.
Everdell is an attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP writing this discovery request on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell.
Bradley Edwards is identified as an attorney who represented victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The defense requests communications between Epstein's attorneys and the government.
The indictment identifies Minor Victims 1-3, whom Maxwell is accused of grooming and trafficking for Epstein. The defense requests extensive information about these individuals.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Signs Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with the government. The defense requests all communications concerning the negotiations of this agreement.

events.title: Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys for victims (including Bradley Edwards) met with SDNY prosecutors to ask them to initiate a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. SDNY declined at that time.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Begins
events.description: The government asserts that the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell began in or about 2018.

events.title: Defense Files Discovery Request
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys file a comprehensive discovery and Brady request with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
Southern District of Florida (referenced for prior Epstein investigation)
New York, New York 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: The defense is seeking the identities and complete birthdates of the individuals identified in the indictment as 'Minor Victims 1-3.'
The defense requests all communications related to the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) signed by Jeffrey Epstein, including unredacted emails between the government and Epstein's attorneys.
The letter reveals that victim attorneys, including Bradley Edwards, met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016 to urge a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell, but SDNY declined at that time.
The defense requests the complete FBI case file on the obstruction of justice investigation of Alfredo Rodriguez.

The defense seeks extensive personal and potentially impeaching information on all alleged victims and witnesses, including diaries, school records, financial records, and evidence of drug/alcohol use.
